title: Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, along with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni, presented research on using large language models (LLMs) to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups. He also moderated a roundtable discussion on data access in the DSA era.
description: This vera.ai article discusses Fabio Giglietto's presentations at conferences in Brazil regarding the use of LLMs for analyzing political discourse and his moderation of a roundtable on data access in the DSA era.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is interviewed regarding his research on how actors respond to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior, specifically in the context of COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy. He discusses the importance of analyzing large-scale data sets to figure out and mitigate bad activity online and explains that coordination isn't necessarily an indicator of negative activity.
description: Fabio Giglietto is interviewed about his research on coordinated behavior and disinformation related to COVID-19 on social media platforms, specifically in the Italian context. The interview discusses the importance of analyzing large data sets to identify and mitigate negative online activity.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article spotlights Fabio Giglietto and his team's work at the University of Urbino as part of the vera.ai project. They coordinate Work Package 4, focusing on detecting potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, specifically addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
description: This article on vera.ai features Fabio Giglietto and his team at the University of Urbino, highlighting their contributions to Work Package 4, which focuses on detecting problematic content in near-real-time by analyzing coordinated sharing behavior.

title: THE BRAZILIAN DIGITAL BATTLEFIELD: INVESTIGATING THE DYNAMICS OF POLITICAL INFORMATION CAMPAIGNS IN POST-BOLSONARO ERA | AoIR Selected Papers of Internet Research
snippet: Giada Marino, Bruna Almeida Paroni and Fabio Giglietto are the authors of the paper. This study investigates the dynamics of misinformation campaigns on Facebook in the context of Brazil's political shifts.
